challenging material and kind of observed what happened and the really interesting thing they noticed was the boys the higher their IQ the more
aggressively they took to the challenge the harder they pursued completion girls the complete opposite the higher the
girls IQ was the more quickly she dropped that material and so they take a step back and these kids are only 10
years old right Society can have done that much damage yet but they started looking at the way we're talking to kids
at that age and when you look at development cycles in the way they grow how do we typically describe boys right
at that age they might be a little bit more rambunctious they might be a little more off task they might be kind of you know going crazy versus girls will
mature a little bit faster that age be able to stay on task pretty well and so what are we telling the boys we're saying hey pay attention hey if you just
focus if you just do this you can figure it out and then we're telling the girls oh you're so smart oh you're so good oh
you did a great job and so we're getting very different messages sent boys and girls boys are being taught if

and so they're coming off with this idea that intelligence is an innate trait that they baby have like this much intelligence and if there's like a
